1. Currency exchange scams: This is when someone offers you a rate for exchanging your currency that is too good to be true. Always research beforehand to know the current exchange rates, and only exchange currency with reputable banks or exchange bureaus.

2. ATM scams: This is when a skimming device is placed on an ATM machine to steal your card information. Always inspect the ATM card slot and keypad before using it, cover your hand while entering your PIN, and use ATMs in well-lit public places.

3. Fake bills: Be cautious when accepting bills, especially in countries where counterfeiting is prevalent. Check the money for obvious signs of forgery before accepting them.

4. Credit card fraud: This involves unauthorized use of your credit card details. Only use ATMs and credit card machines that are reputable and secure. It is also important to regularly check your credit card statements to ensure no unauthorized transactions have taken place.

5. Taxi scams: This occurs when a taxi driver overcharges you for the ride or takes you on a longer route to increase the fare. Use reputable taxi companies, confirm the fare in advance, and use a GPS to track the journey.

To protect yourself from these scams, it is important to be aware and vigilant at all times. Always research beforehand, use reputable services, and avoid carrying large amounts of cash. Keep your passport and other valuables in a secure place such as a hotel safe. Lastly, if you suspect any fraudulent activity, report it immediately to the authorities.
